item.description:
We will see the film "38 Witnesses" (French w/subtitles) at the MFA and then walk over to a nearby cafe for a discussion of the film and the ethics of social responsibility.

38 Witnesses (38 témoins) by Lucas Belvaux (2012, 104 min.). Lucas Belvaux’s haunting new film explores social responsibility and the human consciousness.  Louise returns from a business trip to discover that a woman was brutally murdered in front of her building. The police question the residents, but nobody heard or saw anything—including Louise’s husband, Pierre (Yvan Attal), who returned from work around the time the murder was committed. Belvaux’s tight direction and apt storytelling turns a murder mystery into a brilliant psychological thriller.
